rules: Rule1: Under the condition that artwork1 is auctioned, it is not stolen.
Rule2: Supposing that artwork1 is sold directly, it is not stolen.
Rule3: Given that collector1 purchases artwork1, it follows that collector1 owns artwork1.
Rule4: Collector1 either purchases artwork1 or bids on it.
Rule5: Assuming that collector1 bids on artwork1, then it is either auctioned or sold directly.
Rule6: Whenever collector1 owns artwork1, artwork1 is transferred.
Rule7: Provided that artwork1 is investigated, it is not fraudulent.
Rule8: Supposing that gallery1 reviewed artwork1, then gallery1 endorses it.
Rule9: Assuming that artwork1 is curator reviewed, gallery1 rejects it.
Rule10: Artwork1 is either curator reviewed or committee reviewed.
Rule11: Provided that artwork1 is committee reviewed, then if gallery1 endorses it, the artwork contains original content or does not involve copyright infringement.
Rule12: Artwork1 is either created by artist1 or owned by artist1.
Rule13: In case artwork1 is collateralized, it is genuine.
Rule14: If artwork1 is insured, then it is collateralized.
Rule15: Given that artwork1 is foreclosed, it is seized.
Rule16: If artwork1 has fractional ownership, then provided that it is not genuine, it is disputed.
Rule17: In the case that artwork1 is tokenized, it has fractional ownership.
Rule18: Artwork1 is either tokenized or divided into shares.
Rule19: Provided that artwork1 is divided into shares, it is managed by fund1.
Rule20: If fund1 manages artwork1, then the artwork is traded on an exchange.
Rule21: If artist1 owns artwork1, then should it not be the case that lack of genuineness implies it is not listed on platform1, the artwork is verified.
Rule22: Supposing that fund1 is regulated, then if artwork1 is traded on an exchange, it has fractional ownership.
Rule23: Provided that the market for artwork1 is manipulated, price pumping occurs for it.
Rule24: In the case that the market for artwork1 is manipulated, there is no artificial demand for it.
Rule25: If wash trading occurs for artwork1, there is artificial demand for it.
Rule26: Platform1 either detects manipulation or collector1 reports it.
Rule27: Supposing that collector1 reports manipulation, then if price pumping occurs for artwork1, wash trading occurs for it.
Rule28: If platform1 suspends trading for artwork1, then in case it detects manipulation, then if price pumping occurs, wash trading occurs.
Rule29: Platform1 either suspends trading for artwork1 or is fined.
Rule30: In the case that platform1 is fined, a compliance audit is conducted on it.
Rule31: Supposing that a compliance audit is conducted on platform1, then if it detects manipulation, then if price pumping occurs, wash trading occurs.

Rule32: If artist1 is registered on platform1, then if artwork1 is created by artist1, then should it not be the case that lack of genuineness implies it is not listed on platform1, the artwork is verified.
Rule33: Artist1 is either registered on platform1 or approved by it.
Rule34: Assuming that artist1 is approved by platform1, then artist1 is a member of gallery1.
Rule35: Provided that artist1 is a member of gallery1, then artist1 is represented by gallery1.

Rule36: Supposing that artist1 is represented by gallery1, then if artwork1 is created by artist1, then should it not be the case that lack of genuineness implies it is not listed on platform1, the artwork is verified.
Rule37: If it is not the case that if artwork1 is minted, then provided it is not genuine, it is not authenticated, then artwork1 is stolen.
Rule38: Provided that it is not the case that either a loan defaulted on artwork1 or if platform1 offers a loan for it, the artwork is insured, then artwork1 is foreclosed.
Rule39: Under the condition that it is not the case that either a loan defaulted on artwork1 or if platform1 offers a loan for it, the artwork is insured, then artwork1 is not seized.

Rule40: Supposing that it is not the case that the negation of the statement 'either a loan defaulted on artwork1 or if platform1 offers a loan for it, the artwork is insured' implies that artwork1 is seized, then platform1 does not appeal the decision.

Rule41: In the event that it is not the case that the negation of the negation of the statement 'either a loan defaulted on artwork1 or if platform1 offers a loan for it, the artwork is insured' implies that artwork1 is seized implies that platform1 appeals the decision, then regulator1 upholds the decision.
Rule42: If it is not the case that the negation of the statement 'lack of genuineness implies disputed' implies that artwork1 is investigated, then artwork1 is cleared.

Rule43: Provided that it is not the case that the negation of the statement 'lack of genuineness implies disputed' implies that artwork1 is not fraudulent, then the market for artwork1 is manipulated.
Rule44: Supposing that it is not the case that lack of genuineness implies disputed, then artwork1 is fraudulent.
Rule45: Provided that it is not the case that lack of genuineness implies not listed on platform1, then artwork1 is not verified.
Rule46: In the event that artwork1 is not genuine, it is listed on platform1.
Rule47: Given that artwork1 is not genuine, it involves copyright infringement.
Rule48: Assuming that artwork1 is not genuine, it is authenticated.
Rule49: Under the condition that artwork1 is not genuine, it is not disputed.
facts: Fact3: Platform1 offers a loan for artwork1.
Fact7: Artwork1 does not contain original content.
Fact8: Gallery1 does not reject artwork1.
Fact9: A loan did not default on artwork1.
Fact10: Regulator1 does not uphold the decision.
